control: A formal cybersecurity policy is established, documented, communicated, and enforced
Roles, responsibilities, and authorities for cybersecurity are clearly defined and assigned
Risk management objectives and strategy are established and agreed upon
Cybersecurity performance and risks are periodically reviewed by leadership
Inventories of hardware assets are maintained and regularly updated
Inventories of software, services, and systems are maintained
Assets are classified and prioritized based on criticality and impact
Vulnerabilities are identified, validated, and recorded
Risk responses are planned, prioritized, tracked, and communicated
User identities and credentials are securely managed
Access follows least privilege and separation of duties principles
Personnel receive regular cybersecurity awareness and training
Data at rest is protected for confidentiality, integrity, and availability
Data in transit is protected using encryption and secure protocols
Configuration management practices are established and enforced
Systems and software are regularly updated and patched
Networks and systems are continuously monitored for suspicious activities
Security events are analyzed to understand impact and scope
An incident response plan is established and executed during incidents
Stakeholders are notified and informed during cybersecurity incidents
Incidents are contained and eradicated promptly
Recovery plans are executed to restore systems and services after incidents
Backups are maintained and tested regularly
Recovery progress is communicated to stakeholders
